instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
Can anyone help me out with the 820 00165A?

5V Missing

P5VS4RS3_EN_R fluctuating

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Fluctuating how?
Do you get pulse every 2, or 5 seconds?
Or the voltage fluctuates continuosly?

What about 3v3_S5 (L7560), PPBUS_G3H and 3V42_G3H?
Post some useful information; any history available?

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
Ampere fluctuates between (38 amp to 110 amp)

PPBUS_G3H Present (8.6 V)
PP3V3_S5_REG_R Present (3.3)
PP3v42_G3H Present
PP5V_S4RS3 Missing (5V)

*After removing R7551

Pin 1 on R7551   P5VS4RS3_EN  Present

Pin 2 on R7551 P5VS4RS3_EN fluctuates
 
PP5V_S4RS3 Present (5V)

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
"(38 amp to 110 amp)"
I hope you don't believe this; me NOT.
Make difference between A and mA!!!

Please, post accurate information.
Enable signal on R7551 pins, has different names; check schematic
"Pin 1 on R7551   P5VS4RS3_EN  Present
Pin 2 on R7551 P5VS4RS3_EN fluctuates"
What we should understand from this???

"Fluctuating how?
Do you get pulse every 2, or 5 seconds?
Or the voltage fluctuates continuosly?"
Can we get a clear answer?

"any (fault) history available?"

Did you try starting in SMC bypass?

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
Yes, readings are in mA.  MY BAD

Removed R7551

Pin 1 on R7551 P5VS4RS3_EN_R (Present 5V)

Pin 2 on R7551 P5VS4RS3_EN (Pulsing every 2 Second)

No history before

Can you help me with SMC Bypass? I didn't try. I am learning I am not perfect

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
Yes, readings are in mA. MY BAD

Removed R7551

Pin 1 on R7551 P5VS4RS3_EN_R (Present 5V)

Pin 2 on R7551 P5VS4RS3_EN (Pulsing every 2 Second)

No history before

SMC bypass? I keep the power button down and plug the charger in ,and then release the power button.....Fan Rotates for a sec and then turns oFF

NO Difference

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
If fan tries to spin, probably more voltages try to appear on the board.
Check for pulse at all big coils.
Also check pins 1, 3 & 7 of U1950.

Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for pulse at mentioned points (at same time).

Inspect Q8150 and U1950 areas for corrosion.

If machine came from a client, didn't say anything?

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
I disconnected the  L7430 from pin 2

Pin 2 ( PPDDR_S3_REG_R ) : 2 V on the coil 

All coil voltages are stable 

L7560 = 3.3 V
L7520 = 5V
L7630 = 1.05
L7430 = 2V (Pin 2 end of the coil is disconnected from the board)... This should be 1.2V, but I am getting 2V on Pin2 of the coil which is disconnected from the board. ANY Solutions?

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
I can't help in this way.
You've been asked to do same checkings on the board.

Very likely corrosion on Q8150, or U1950 areas.
Maybe some problems around U7400, god knows.
We need some accurate information.

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
Board looks clean to me ....I am checking under microscope

is it possible ?  L7430 = 2V (Pin 2 end of the coil is disconnected from the board)... This should be 1.2V, but I am getting 2V on Pin2 of the coil which is disconnected from the board

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
How can you think to test a buck converter without its coil???

Let me know when you decide to post some useful information...

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
Sir, One end on the coil is connected on the coil and other end(PIN 2) is in the air.

Please ask your questions ,I will not touch it unless you ask me to do

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
Sir, One end of the coil is connected to the board and other end(PIN 2) is in the air.

Please ask your questions ,I will not touch it unless you ask me to do

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
Resolder ALL BACK on the board.

"Check for pulse at all big coils.
Also check pins 1, 3 & 7 of U1950.

Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for pulse at mentioned points (at same time).

Inspect Q8150 and U1950 areas for corrosion."

No need to write double posts.
Please maintain forum aesthetic...

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
No corrosion detected near  Q8150 and U1950 areas

Before trigger SMC_ON_OFF_L

U1950

pins 1: Pulsing

Pin 3: Pulsing

Pin 7: Pulsing


After trigger SMC_ON_OFF_L

U1950

pins 1: Pulsing

Pin 3: Pulsing

Pin 7:  Pulsing

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
You didn't understand what trigger SMC_ONOFF_L means.

However, now remove Q8150 and test if get stable voltage on big coils (at least few of them).

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
SMC_ONOFF_L : It shorted together for a millisecond 

Anyways..... I removed Q8150 and still the same situation 

No stable voltage any other big coils 

Only stable voltage on L7130 and L7560

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
"shorted together for a millisecond"
Yeah, but expected reaction must be checked at same time; in this milisecond!
Not before, nor after.

Keep Q8150 out of board.
Now remove R8164/65/66/68, one by one; keep R8167 on its place.
Tell us when (if) voltage appears on the coils.

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
Voltage is stable on all the coils 

Current : 140 mA

L7130  =8.6V
L7520 = 5.1 V
L7560 = 3.3 V
L7430 = 1.2V
L7630 = 1.05V
L7320 =1.6V
L7310 =1.6V

But it is going in original state sometimes when I plug out and plug it back in to DC supply

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
I said to remove the mentioned resistors one by one and tell us when voltages come on.
Don't you want to help us to diagnose anything on this board???

"when I plug out and plug it back in to DC supply"
Are you using lab PSU, not original Magsafe 2 charger?

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
I hope you've removed first R8166 (not R8165).
Just need to know the exact moment when voltages came on.
Put back the other resistors and be sure these voltages are still there.

Now tell us if you get 1.8V at L7820.

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
Pulsing (35 mA to 140 mA)
I removed all the  R8166  R8165  R8164  R8168 , one by one and all at one time...... No difference ...it is still pulsing...


After Removing R8167

it become stable at 130 mA

I tested this 5 Times.... these readings are final and tested

threads.title: 820 00165A .... 5v Missing
threads.message:
I was very clear: KEEP R8167 IN PLACE!!!

You've said to get voltages when removed R8166.
I supposed all other resistors being soldered on board.

I asked you about [B][U]voltage[/U][/B] at L7820 and you came back with [B][U]current[/U][/B] readings.

Is really difficil to help you.
As you do what you want, instead of what is needed.
